messages: 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:53): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: "In that case, you a probably better off tracking XHTML5 as opposed to XHTML 1.1." -- s/a /are /
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:59): harri, http://tc.labs.opera.com/apis/XMLHttpRequest/
b19bfcbd7b695025e49d546be54e168b (23:00): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I am quite impressive by how you folks don't block the UI on synchronous (puke) XHR
b19bfcbd7b695025e49d546be54e168b (23:00): impressed, that is.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:02): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: thanks. fixed
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (23:03): synchronous APIs are bad
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (23:03): albeit convenient
8c8837db54a2907cacd8633547977e33 (23:03): just gotta bite the bullet
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:05): ABNF isn't expressive enough.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:07): b19bfcbd7b695025e49d546be54e168b, that's probably one of my favorite Opera features
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:08): RFC 1952 is too vague.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:11): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: does Presto run in the UI thread nonetheless?
b19bfcbd7b695025e49d546be54e168b (23:11): hmm, looks like we need lots of work on that tc..
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:12): I'd recommend coding against http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/XMLHttpRequest/ and then use the tests to verify
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:12): so we can catch bugs in both
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:12): (well, and in your impl :) )
b19bfcbd7b695025e49d546be54e168b (23:12): Well, the code is there, but it could surely use an audit.
b19bfcbd7b695025e49d546be54e168b (23:12): how interoperable is the stuff the tests test?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:12): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, can't comment on that I think
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:13): b19bfcbd7b695025e49d546be54e168b, it's compatible with other browsers
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:13): I think we aligned with IE the most
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:20): acid test moved: http://acid3.acidtests.org/
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:22): Hixie: acid3 just crashed my copy of firefox 2
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:28): so is text/html;charset=latin1 identical to text/html;charset=iso-8859-1 ?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:30): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: if you use an alias, v.nu will tell you the preferred iana name
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:30): but aliases are supported and such?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:31): http://validator.nu/?doc=http%3A%2F%2Fw3.org%2F&charset=latin1
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:31): yes, latin1 is an alias of iso-8859-1
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:32): oh, did you mean supported in browsers? I'm not sure
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:32): regarding that document, the lang= attribute value message is confusing
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:32): yeah, i'd guess so...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:33): would be nice if documentation on this sucked less
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:34): and also exact algorithms for bytestream + encoding -> unicode character stream
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:34): which message is confusing?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:34): including handling errors, etc.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:34): " Attribute lang not allowed on XHTML element html at this point."
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:34): where you mean xml:lang probably
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:35): oh wait
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:35): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: no, lang is not allowed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:35): xml:lang is allowed
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:35): it's served as XML, blah
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:35): hmm. the page has hreflang='en-uk' even
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:36): i think lang= should be allowed, but i don't care enough to raise it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:38): "XML processors are required to support the UTF-8 and UTF-16 character encodings. The encoding was latin1 instead, which is an incompatibility risk."
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:38): wasn't that supposedly disabled for ISO-8859-1?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:40): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yeah, but apparently, the code compares the declared charset--not the canonical name
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:41): which is OK, considering that aliases may not be as safe as "ISO-8859-1"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:42): compare with http://validator.nu/?doc=http%3A%2F%2Fw3.org%2F&charset=iso-8859-1
